conclusion: Determine how much work is done by the frictional force of the conveyor belt on the object.
The object is subject to a frictional force when it is placed on the conveyor belt.
Calculate the frictional force using f = Î¼mg, resulting in f = 9 N.
Determine the acceleration of the object due to friction using a = f/m, resulting in a = 3 m/s^2.
The object starts from rest and accelerates to match the conveyor belt's speed v = 6 m/s.
Use the kinematic equation v^2 = u^2 + 2as to solve for s, resulting in s = 6 m.
Calculate the work done by the frictional force using W_f = f * s, resulting in W_f = 54 J.
The work done by the frictional force of the conveyor belt on the object as it is transported from point M to point N is 54 J.
